An agent encrypted a passphrase using RSA, but part of the private key leaked. Can you recover the original message from 7445715679590596640391060231772565149663049114590120218809095222995139463047232015363299121849421801753550494206279504824030507400891598285353106808273255 using this vulnerability?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8174548126750548814002049523980487447027981655843434647366189504663069572225892738532976639824700035294734055580817559418674378323008081601213653597089579, e=1664052334169521716817462546495771531506739807537215750800852893167679398520238630184373739607600478261618219098238833138397675922152635203849854260064639, partial_p=12006862590473042125

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{bzccycve}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 7445715679590596640391060231772565149663049114590120218809095222995139463047232015363299121849421801753550494206279504824030507400891598285353106808273255
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8174548126750548814002049523980487447027981655843434647366189504663069572225892738532976639824700035294734055580817559418674378323008081601213653597089579, e=1664052334169521716817462546495771531506739807537215750800852893167679398520238630184373739607600478261618219098238833138397675922152635203849854260064639, partial_p=12006862590473042125
extra_info: p=75368298003207749992914996816137761728832800994203456765646686582702504112877, q=108461360324239136807765255838849408271917144095777023098450083537783497764727, Ï†(n)=8174548126750548814002049523980487447027981655843434647366189504663069572225708908874649192937899355042079068410816809473584397843143984831093167595211976
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
